autodelete.permission_denied: âŒ Only level {level}+ members can manage auto-delete.
autodelete.invalid_command: âŒ The command must start with '/'.

documentation.sections.overview.title: â„¹ï¸ Main commands
documentation.sections.moderation.title: ğŸ›¡ Moderation module
documentation.sections.moderation.conten: /kick â€” kick a user without a ban.
/modlevel â€” assign moderation levels (0 = members, 5 = chat creator; levels control all moderation actions).
/restrict â€” list members with a specific moderation level.
/restrictcommand â€” limit a command to a specific moderator level.
documentation.sections.filters.title: ğŸš¦ Filters
documentation.sections.filters.content.0: /filteradd â€” add a new rule (reply to a message).
documentation.sections.filters.content.4: /filterclear â€” remove all filters in the chat.
documentation.sections.filters.content.5: Use {randomUser}, {randomMention} or {randomRpUser} in templates to mention a random member.
documentation.sections.filters.content.6: Tags {argument} and {argumentNoQuestion} insert text after the trigger (with or without question marks).
documentation.sections.autodelete.title: â™»ï¸ Auto-delete
documentation.sections.autodelete.conten: /autodelete /command â€” add a command to auto-delete.
/nodelete /command â€” exclude a command from auto-delete.
documentation.sections.roleplay.title: ğŸ² Roleplay

moderation.ban.usage:
âŒ Invalid usage! Examples:
/ban @user 1d spam - Ban user for 1 day
/ban 2h @user - Ban user for 2 hours
/ban @user - Permanent ban
Or reply to a message with /ban 1d

entertainment.jokes.dark_mode: Why do programmers prefer dark mode? Because light attracts bugs!
